title: HEART Pathway for Early Discharge in Acute Chest Pain
description: Identifies emergency department patients with acute chest pain for early discharge. Combines HEART score with serial troponin measurements to risk-stratify patients.

options.label: ≥3 risk factors or history of atherosclerotic disease

parameters.name: repeat_troponin_negative
parameters.description: 3-hour repeat troponin result (only for low-risk patients)

ranges.interpretation: Low risk for major adverse cardiac events. With negative initial troponin, repeat troponin at 3 hours. If both troponins negative, safe for early discharge with outpatient follow-up.
High risk for major adverse cardiac events. Admit to hospital or observation unit for further cardiac evaluation, serial troponins, and objective cardiac testing.

special_rules: HEART score ≤3 AND initial troponin negative: Obtain 3-hour troponin
HEART score ≤3 AND both troponins negative: Safe for early discharge
HEART score ≥4 OR any positive troponin: Admit for further evaluation
Initial troponin score 1-2 points (elevated): High risk regardless of total score

references: Mahler SA, Riley RF, Hiestand BC, Russell GB, Hoekstra JW, Lefebvre CW, et al. The HEART Pathway randomized trial: identifying emergency department patients with acute chest pain for early discharge. Circ Cardiovasc Qual Outcomes. 2015 Mar;8(2):195-203. doi: 10.1161/CIRCOUTCOMES.114.001384.

Mahler SA, Stopyra JP, Apple FS, Riley RF, Russell GB, Hiestand BC, et al. Use of the HEART Pathway with high sensitivity cardiac troponins: a secondary analysis. Clin Biochem. 2017 May;50(7-8):401-407. doi: 10.1016/j.clinbiochem.2016.11.018.

Backus BE, Six AJ, Kelder JC, Bosschaert MA, Mast EG, Mosterd A, et al. A prospective validation of the HEART score for chest pain patients at the emergency department. Int J Cardiol. 2013 Oct 3;168(3):2153-8. doi: 10.1016/j.ijcard.2013.01.255.
formula: HEART Score = History + ECG + Age + Risk Factors + Initial Troponin (Range: 0-10)
notes: Risk factors include: hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, diabetes mellitus, obesity (BMI >30), smoking (current or quit <3 months), positive family history (parent or sibling with CVD <65 years), atherosclerotic disease (prior MI, PCI/CABG, CVA/TIA, or peripheral arterial disease)
The HEART Pathway requires serial troponin measurements at 0 and 3 hours
Designed for patients presenting to ED with acute chest pain
Not validated for patients with STEMI, hemodynamic instability, or life-threatening causes of chest pain
